alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 11:32AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. * WHEN...Until 730 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1132 AM PST, local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Baker Creek, Owens River, Shepherd Creek, Big Pine Canal, Sawmill Creek, Oak Creek, North Fork Oak Creek, Birch Creek, Symmes Creek, Goodale Creek, Big Pine Creek, Bairs Creek, Independence Creek, Pinyon Creek, Division Creek, Little Pine Creek, Tinemaha Creek, George Creek and Taboose Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Independence, Big Pine, Sawmill Creek Campground, Goodale Creek Campground, Taboose Creek Campground, Oak Creek Campground, Tinemaha Campground, Independence Creek Campground and Baker Creek Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
